X.T: How Open Source Projects Survive Poisonous People (And You Can Too)

ARTICLE.AUTHOR: Ben Collins-Sussman
Brian W. Fitzpatrick
ARTICLE.COMMENT: How to deal with people who distract attention and focus. After suggesting to have a mission, to define a mailing list etiquette, to document project history, to define code collaboration policies, to have well-defined processes, to avoid using votes… in an open source project, the two guys speak about detecting poisonous people and getting rid of them. They punctuate their speech with many anecdotes.
